column4: everytime i log in to x, nautilus opens my home directory, how can i make it stop?
hey, how can i make nautilus start my home-directory on startup?
yeah fedora's no fun...
save your session on exit
ah - not what you asked
any ideas?
maybe edit the properties in the menu to open nautilus at the dir you want?
or create a launcher to do it
on boot, or any time? On boot I just hold down Ctrl-C when that bit arrives in the sequence (if I'm not connected)
sorry i wasn't so specific... i mean on boot.
ctrl c... but isn't it possible to disable it somehow?
well, yes I guess in the /etc/init.d/ntpdate script or somewhere like that
any idea on what i can change in that file to disable it?
umm ... I'd have to look (I don't bother)
you could probably disable it with the update-rc.d utility
update-rc.d - install and remove System-V style init script links  (from the man page)
be careful - grub has weird commenting conventions
read crefully
there's one on the mplayer site
no mplayerhq something
seems to work well, yes
